A friend highly recommended this place and the interiors were chic and the tapas were certainly very good.  I did not love the fact that it was mostly English speaking tourists there though as opposed to locals - and I was a solo traveler who was given a seat at a bar facing a brick wall, which felt a bit like I was dining in a Spanish prison (instead of being given a seat in the window or at one of the two actual bars) which would have made for a much nicer atmosphere so I truly wanted to get out of there as soon as possible (which was perhaps the idea as I was the only woman eating alone in the restaurant?) However, I was subjected to a complete SCAM where the waiter slammed down a bottle of water that I didn't order in front of me, opened it, and poured a small amount into a glass. I never ordered, nor wanted, this water and I didn't touch it. When the bill arrived - of course, there was a 3 euro ($4) charge for the water. I informed them that I didn't order it. The waiter claimed he heard me - and refused to acknowledge his error. Then another staff member came over and said she would ask the owner about removing the water from the bill - and she returned saying the owner refused to remove the charge because the bottle was open (not by me.) I pointed out that I never even had a sip of the water and they didn't care.  Other nearby diners (all American) also found this to be ridiculous - but, the staff could care less.  I would NEVER recommend anyone go here with practices like that.  Why risk your reputation over 3 euros - but clearly, they wanted to add more money to the bill of a solo diner and to take advantage.  Shame on them.
